svtool.core
Interface Task

All Known Implementing Classes:
DatabaseConnector, ServiceDataPopulator
public interface Task

The parent class of all Task objects. These objects represent tasks that can run in parallel and can have their progress monitored.

Field Summary
static int CANCELLED
          Indicates that the task has been cancelled.
static int EXECUTING
          Indicates that the task is still executing.
static int FAILED
          Indicates that the task has completed but unsuccessfully.
static int SUCCEEDED
          Indicates that the task has completed successfully.
 
Method Summary
 int getCurrentValue()
          Gets the current value of the task.
 int getMaximumValue()
          Gets the maximum value of the task.

          Get the message.
 int getMinimumValue()
          Gets the minimum value of the task.
 double getPercentComplete()
          Tells the value completed.
 java.lang.Object getResult()
          Gets the object which is the result of the task execution.
 int getTaskStatus()
          Tells the status of the task.
 void startTask()
          Starts the task.
 boolean stopTask()
          Stops the task.

Method Detail

getCurrentValue

public int getCurrentValue()
Gets the current value of the task.

Returns:
Returns the current value. A negative value would indicate an task of indeterminate length.

getMinimumValue

public int getMinimumValue()
Gets the minimum value of the task.

Returns:
Returns the minimum value. A negative value would indicate an task of indeterminate length.

getMaximumValue

public int getMaximumValue()
Gets the maximum value of the task.

Returns:
Returns the maximum value. A negative value would indicate an task of indeterminate length.

getPercentComplete

public double getPercentComplete()
Tells the value completed.

Returns:
Returns the percentage completed value of this task. A negative value would indicate an task of indeterminate length.

getMessage

public java.lang.String getMessage()
Get the message.

Returns:
Return a string based message description of the task.

getTaskStatus

public int getTaskStatus()
Tells the status of the task.

Returns:
SUCCESS - Finished successfully.
FAILED - Task failed.
CANCELLED - Task was cancelled.
PERFORMING - Task still going one.

startTask

public void startTask()
Starts the task.

stopTask

public boolean stopTask()
Stops the task.

Returns:
False if task stopping failed.

getResult

public java.lang.Object getResult()
Gets the object which is the result of the task execution. This call is invalid if the task is still executing. Technically this should block till execution has completed.

Returns:
Returns the object encapsulating the "core" of this Task.
